title: Iran sends warships to Gulf of Aden - navy

content: No SH*T CJ, what's next. They really do seemed to be posturing. What will we do? This is a true test for our New President. I personally would send warships to stalemate them, but it may esculate things. Between N Korea and Iran, both of which are working together, we may have the beginnings of the next world war. Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin

content: Seems like they are anyway. NK on the right Iran on the left. It's ok though, call in the carriers. I am not concerned about NK or Iran we'll whoop them with eyes shut but I concerned with China and Russia. As long as they stay out of it...not half as bad as if they got in it.

content: Great, another media event. Let's see, we have somewhere in the neighborhood of 5,700 active stockpiled nuclear warheads and the Iranians have a small POS PT boat navy...clearly a "clear and present danger" to US sovereignty. This is a case of mutual masturbation between the Iranians and the media…they both feel good but accomplish nothing.

title: Iran sends warships to Gulf of Aden - navy

content: Anyone here know where the Gulf of Aden IS in relation to Iran? A lot closer than you might think. Besides, with all the crap going on off the coast of Somalia, more of a military presence is not a bad thing. They have just as much right to protect their oil exporters as we have to protect Maersk Shipping. Why do we get all bent out of shape when other countries do things that we see as routine for ourselves? It's not as though they're dogging our CVBGs like the Russians did. So they sent the Kharg and a few corvettes out for a cruise. Whoopdee-doo.
